pull.title: add more tests for leading zero
pull.body:
In the library [btcsuite/btcutil](https://github.com/btcsuite/btcutil) and [decred/dcrd](https://github.com/decred/dcrd) all the tests that are listed here pass successfully, but there is an error on my case. 
```
seed: "57fb1e450b8afb95c62afbcd49e4100d6790e0822b8905608679180ac34ca0bd45bf7ccc6c5f5218236d0eb93afc78bd117b9f02a6b7df258ea182dfaef5aad7", 
path: "m/44H/60H/0H",
want pub: "xpub6CpsfWjghR6XdCB8yDq7jQRpRKEDP2LT3ZRUgURF9g5xevB7YoTpogkFRqq5nQtVSN8YCMZo2CD8u4zCaxRv85ctCWmzEi9gQ5DBhBFaTNo", 
want priv: "xprv9yqXG1Cns3YEQi6fsCJ7NGV5sHPiyZcbgLVst61dbLYyn7qy1G9aFtRmaYp481ounqnVf9Go2ymQ4gmxZLEwYSRhU868aDk4ZxzGvqJVH"
```
The correction and discussion can be found here https://github.com/btcsuite/btcutil/pull/161

events.message:
add more tests for leading zero

In the library https://github.com/btcsuite/btcutil and https://github.com/decred/dcrd all the tests that are listed here pass successfully, but there is an error on my case. Seed: "57fb1e450b8afb95c62afbcd49e4100d6790e0822b8905608679180ac34ca0bd45bf7ccc6c5f5218236d0eb93afc78bd117b9f02a6b7df258ea182dfaef5aad7", want pub: "xpub6CpsfWjghR6XdCB8yDq7jQRpRKEDP2LT3ZRUgURF9g5xevB7YoTpogkFRqq5nQtVSN8YCMZo2CD8u4zCaxRv85ctCWmzEi9gQ5DBhBFaTNo", want priv: "xprv9yqXG1Cns3YEQi6fsCJ7NGV5sHPiyZcbgLVst61dbLYyn7qy1G9aFtRmaYp481ounqnVf9Go2ymQ4gmxZLEwYSRhU868aDk4ZxzGvqJVH". The correction and discussion can be found here https://github.com/btcsuite/btcutil/pull/161

events.body:
@klim0v Does btcutil not fail the existing test vector 3? If not, in what way does this one differ?

If we're adding this, please make it a test vector 4 rather than squishing it into vector 3.

verification.payload:
tree 4b5f48258a392eead4acb49037ffd25420fa88e8
parent eaa4e10ef2e5d963ce8fdf389d50e5a7c1a21b5c
author Klimov Sergey <klim0v-sergey@yandex.ru> 1588347149 +0300
committer GitHub <noreply@github.com> 1588347149 +0300

add test vector 4

issue.title: added test vector #5 for invalid extended keys
issue.body: The BIP32 specification lacks test vectors for invalid extended keys that should not be parsed as valid. Such test vectors are proposed here.

issue.title: why not add leading zero bytes to make childkey 32 bytes long?
issue.body:
See [extendedkey.go:297](https://github.com/btcsuite/btcutil/blob/b2bf7f89d674a3702182b7e15f52807896051af3/hdkeychain/extendedkey.go#L297)
The bytes length may be smaller than 32. Is there  any bug when deriving hardened private key?
The derived key with padding differs.

events.body:
NACK
Unless I am missing something, a library not failing at test vector #3 would not fail at this new proposed case:
e.g. see https://github.com/btclib-org/btclib/commit/0cab43454b876d190a743a7886d77ad8ed0e8255
Is this resolved and can be closed, or is there still an issue that needs addressing?
